title: Stuart Woods - Hot Mahogany
description:
HOT MAHOGANY
By: Stuart Woods
Read by: Tony Roberts


Stone Barrington returns to take on an underworld of crime that gives a new meaning to "old money."
 
In Stuart Woods's engaging new thriller, Stone Barrington is lured from Elaine's to New England, and the genteel but cutthroat world of priceless antiques, historic homes, and lavish country estates. In a place dominated by blue bloods and their inherited wealth, along with the nouveau riche, there arc surprisingly few rules of engagement, and Stone finds himself navigating a dangerous course, one where even the most expensive and sought-after status symbols are sometimes stolen and sometimes clever fakes, though no less priceless.
 
With its swift action, bold characters, and wit as dry as the best martini, "Hot Mahogany" is another must-read from the pen of a master entertainer.

STUART WOODS is the author of thirty-eight novels, including the New York Times-bestselling Stone Barrington series and Holly Barker series. An avid pilot and sailor, he divides his time among New York City, Florida, and Maine.

TONY ROBERTS is a gifted actor who has appeared on the Broadway stage and in films. Twice a Tony nominee, he has starred in "Xanadu", "Barefoot in the Park", "Don't Drink the Water", and "Victor, Victoria". His film credits include "Annie Hall", "Serpico", and "Play It Again, Sam". He can be heard on several Stone Barrington audiobooks.

Approximately 8 hours from 7 CDs in MP3 format.
